0.name: Pedro4
0.text:
It worked. My disguise was enough to make them believe I was with them. I have been assigned a room in the guard chambers.
This facility is much larger.
The clouds seem to end before the building does.
The conditions are not better either. I feel for the workers.
In some places it's warm enough to melt skin off muscle.

Now I'm here I will need to get accustomed to the standard procedures. I will also need to study the building a bit more before I can start planning anything.
Not to mention figure out where Jareck is among all of this.
But I will have my vengeance.
One way or another.

1.name: Pedro5
1.text:
I've been here for 4 weeks. I've learned much.
I have gotten used to the procedures and the protocols of this place.
Despite what it might seem from the perspective of the workers below.
Being a guard here is a differnt kind of imprisoning.
Instead of constant physical labour you're put through committing actions that'll break a man.
While I don't share the same chains as those below.
I feel just as shackled.

However, I know my way to the upper layers.
I have seen him. He takes two smoke breaks by the left most fire exit at the bottom. Usually around 11am and 7pm.
The only place that's not monitored here is a small storage closet near the stairs atop the upper floor.
If I can sneak in there. With the right timing...
I can give him what he deserves.

2.name: Pedro6
2.text:
This is writ with bloodied hands.
Parts of Jareck's brain still between my fingernails.
I succeeded.

My chest is bleedin. A searing pain from one side to the other. I believe he shot me in my ambush.
Though I only geel it now.
My adrenaline kept me going. I was on top of him.
Every fist that struck his face was fueled by unmatched anger.
I asked what happened to my wife and child..
He didn't even know who I was.
I now realise the road I drove would lead to nowhere.
I killed the man I hated so much.
Yet nothing's changed. I feel no different.
My family is still missing. And soon my breath will be my last.
I was damned from the day I was taken.

3.name: Task4
3.text:
As per usual, I leave a note.
I'm only getting closer to completing my task.
The cancer that grows within me makes me feel weaker by the day.
But I must continue.
He will heal me.

I must say I enjoyed the peace that Dreck brought me.
It was cold yet empty. It felt like nothing was there to bother me.
I felt alone but.. the good kind.
I really.. needed that.
The war had quite a toll on me. Even if it's all I know.
I mean. I was practically created by it.
Just like many others.

... I should get the fuel I came here for and proceed to Faith.
